unnormalised: Breaking News! Drama unfolds at Tech Mahindra's quarterly meet!
normalised: breaking news! drama unfolds at tech mahindra's quarterly meet!

unnormalised: Things got a tad spicy at Tech Mahindra's Q3 results presentation today. Apparently, Mr. Sharma, the perpetually stressed-out "Associate VP of Strategic Alliances" (or, as some call him, "The Spreadsheet Whisperer"), accidentally introduced Ms. Kapoor, the fiery new "Director of Innovation and Blue-Sky Thinking" (aka "Ideas Cannon"), as the "Director of Imitation and Slightly-Less-Cloudy Day Dreaming." Oops!
normalised: things got a tad spicy at tech mahindra's Q-three results presentation today. apparently, mister sharma, the perpetually stressed-out "associate V-P of strategic alliances" (or, as some call him, "the spreadsheet whisperer"), accidentally introduced miss kapoor, the fiery new "director of innovation and blue-sky thinking" (a-k-a "ideas cannon"), as the "director of imitation and slightly-less-cloudy day dreaming." oops!

unnormalised: The incident, reportedly fueled by a triple espresso and a mild existential crisis, caused a ripple of awkward laughter and nervous coughing throughout the conference room. Witnesses say Ms. Kapoor, usually radiating sunshine and disruptive energy, gave Mr. Sharma a look that could curdle lassi from 50 paces. The "Head of Corporate Synergy", a Mr. Iyer, tried to smooth things over, but only managed to further complicate things by calling the whole thing a "perfect example of emergent chaos," before excusing himself to "find a quiet corner to question his life choices".
normalised: the incident, reportedly fueled by a triple espresso and a mild existential crisis, caused a ripple of awkward laughter and nervous coughing throughout the conference room. witnesses say miss kapoor, usually radiating sunshine and disruptive energy, gave mister sharma a look that could curdle lassi from fifty paces. the "head of corporate synergy", a mister iyer, tried to smooth things over, but only managed to further complicate things by calling the whole thing a "perfect example of emergent chaos," before excusing himself to "find a quiet corner to question his life choices".

unnormalised: However, ever the professional, Ms. Kapoor took it in stride, quipping that perhaps "imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, even if it's accidental". Mr. Sharma, bless his soul, mumbled apologies and attributed the gaffe to "insufficient caffeine levels". The stock price remained, thankfully, unaffected, closing the day at Rs. 1250. Next time someone should hide his coffee at these big meetings.
normalised: however, ever the professional, miss kapoor took it in stride, quipping that perhaps "imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, even if it's accidental". mister sharma, bless his soul, mumbled apologies and attributed the gaffe to "insufficient caffeine levels". the stock price remained, thankfully, unaffected, closing the day at rupee one thousand two hundred and fifty. next time someone should hide his coffee at these big meetings.
